summary:
[i][b]Just ENB and SweetFX[/b][/i] is a regularly updated 'built from the ground up' preset striving to be the fastest configuration around while still maintaining nice visuals. Designed for easy customisation, a guide helps you plug in other effects or apply my optimisations to your current setup.

Desktop and laptop support.
descriptionHtml:

[size=3][b]     [color=#ffd966] [/color][/b][color=#ffd966]->[/color][/size] [color=#d8d8d8]If you get some nice screenshots, please feel free to submit them :)[/color]

Also releasing an Enderal preset...[/color]
[/color]               - High performance Ambient Occlusion option

[size=3][b]      [/b][color=#ffd966]->[/color][/size][b] [/b][color=#d8d8d8]I[/color][color=#d8d8d8]f you see major lighting issues then feel free to give:

               - weather
               - Time of Day
               - any weather/lighting/darkness mods used.

[size=3]      [color=#ffd966]->[/color] [/size][color=#d8d8d8]Visit me on my [url=https://www.facebook.com/free.modding/]facebook[/url] page. Post something interesting?[/color]
[/color]

[size=4][color=#0b5394] [/color][color=#3d85c6]___[/color][/size][/b][b][size=4][color=#3d85c6] [/color]CONTENTS [color=#3d85c6]________________________[/color][/size][/b]
[color=#f9cb9c][size=3] 
[/size][/color][size=2][color=#3d85c6] 1. INTRODUCTION
 2. PREVIOUS INSTALLATIONS

 4. COMPATIBILITY AND RECOMMENDED MODS

 6. NVIDIA INSTALLATION NOTES
 7. ATI INSTALLATION NOTES
 8. CUSTOMISATION AND TWEAKING[/color]

       SWEETFX
       GRAPHICS DRIVER SETTINGS[/color]

[color=#d8d8d8]       DOF
       Lens Textures
       Sunsprite Effects[/color]
[color=#3d85c6]10. LINKS TO OTHER MODS AND PRESETS[/color]
[color=#3d85c6]11. CREDITS[/color]
[/size]



[b][size=4][color=#3d85c6] ___[/color]1. INTRODUCTION [color=#3d85c6]__________________[/color][/size][/b]

An ENB preset built from the ground up, that on its own emphasises a drive for unparalleled performance, essential visual improvements and a pure representation of the game. It has also been designed for you to apply the optimisations, tweaks and other customisations to an already favourite ENB! Yay!

[b][color=#3d85c6][size=3]MAIN FEATURES:[/size][/color][/b]

 [color=#ffd966][size=3]+[/size][/color] ENB and SweetFX engine with Anti Aliasing and Memory Patches
[size=3] [color=#ffd966]+[/color][/size] Customised SkyLighting and Detailed Shadows
 [color=#ffd966][size=3]+[/size][/color] Fine tuned TimeOfDay settings
 [color=#ffd966][size=3]+[/size][/color] ENB Weather ready
 [color=#ffd966][size=3]+[/size][/color] Exceptional performance
 [color=#ffd966][size=3]+[/size][/color] Optimised presets for desktops and laptops (without compromise!)
 [color=#ffd966][size=3]+[/size][/color] Easy and detailed customisation of effects and visuals
 [color=#ffd966][size=3]+[/size][/color] Highly compatible with other mods




[b][size=4][color=#3d85c6] ___ [/color]2. PREVIOUS INSTALLATIONS [color=#3d85c6]_________[/color][/size][/b]

In order to ensure least possible chance of conflicts please ensure to remove the following files from you Skyrim directory.

[color=#ffd966][b]PLEASE NOTE! [/b]Always be safe and backup files in case something goes wrong![/color]

Remove the following from [b]Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim [/b]directory:

(IF FILE IS MISSING JUST SKIP IT!)

[b]enbhost.exe [/b]
[b]d3d9.dll[/b]

[b]d3d9_boost.dll[/b]
[b]d3d9sfx.dll[/b]

[b]enbpalette.bmp[/b]

[b]enblocal.ini[/b]
[b]enbseries.ini[/b]

[b]enbseries[/b] /folder
[b]SweetFX [/b]/ folder

[ALL] [b].fx [/b]files

[b]effect.txt[/b]
[b]SweetFX_preset.txt[/b]
[b]SweetFX_settings.txt[/b]




[b][size=4][color=#e69138] [/color][color=#3d85c6]___ [/color]3. REQUIREMENTS [color=#3d85c6]_________________[/color][/size][/b]

[b]PLEASE NOTE![/b] When using ENBs you must [u][b]disable all game and graphic card Anti Aliasing and Anisotropic Filtering[/b][/u] otherwise some effects will look weird or not work at all and also cause performance problems! (in-game FXAA seems to work and not have negative impacts, except being blurry...)

[size=3] [color=#3d85c6][b]a)[/b][/color] [color=#3d85c6][b]ENB FILES[/b][/color][/size]

You need:

[list=1]
[*][u][b]ONLY[/b][/u] "[b]enbhost.exe[/b]" and "[b]d3d9.dll[/b]" files from the "WrapperVersion" in this [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0303.htm]ENBSeries link[/url] (scroll down and download link is a little arrow/box icon in the bottom-left).
 
[*][b]"enbhelper.dll" [/b]from [url=http://www.dev-c.com/skyrim/enbhelper/]AB Software Development[/url] which you put in the [b]enbseries[/b] [b]folder[/b] after you have installed everything else!
  
[*]a) For [b][u]ReShade Version[/u][/b] (desktops) you need to download [url=http://reshade.me/sweetfx]SweetFX ReShade Suite[/url] (green download button towards bottom)
[/list][size=2]  
          [b]OR[/b]
   
   b) For the [b][u]Booster Version[/u] [/b](laptops) you need to install [url=https://www.reddit.com/r/sweetfx/comments/28exv0/boulotaur2024s_injector_with_151_shaders_x64/]Boulotaur2024 Sweet FX Injector[/url] and [url=https://mods.curse.com/mods/skyrim/skyrim-better-performance]Skyrim Better Performance[/url] files

[/size]      i) In the SweetFX download for [b]32bit[/b] you must change the root [b]d3d9.dll[/b] to [b]SweetFX.dll[/b]. Please note that Skyrim is a 32bit executable and therefore the 64bit SweetFX version will not work as expected, if at all!

     ii)[b] [/b]The [b]d3d9.dll[/b] in the Skyrim Better Performance download needs to be renamed to [b]d3d9_boost.dll[/b] in order to work with this preset installation.[list=1]
 
 [/list][color=#ffd966][b]ATTENTION![/b] Be [b][u]very [/u][/b]careful using 'BruteForce' mode. ENBdev.com statement: [i]"[/i][/color][color=#ffd966][i]Be careful with it, low quality videocards or overclocked can be corrupted"[/i][/color][color=#ffd966]! [/color]

Also please consider showing your appreciation to Boris/SweetFX teams and/or contribute to their projects if you can as the team works hard to bring the amazing improvements that these technologies allow.


[color=#3d85c6][size=3] [b]b)[/b] [b]Skyrim.ini[/b][/size][/color]

[color=#ffd966][b]PLEASE NOTE! [/b]Always be safe and backup files in case something goes wrong![/color]

This tweak is already in my custom [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6131/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D6131&pUp=1]ini files[/url]. If using your own then the following are not necessary, but can improve performance greatly! The S[b]kyrim.ini[/b] file is found in [b][USERNAME]/My Documents/My Games/Skyrim[/b] :

(IF YOU CANNOT SEE THE ENTRIES, CREATE THEM)

[color=#ff0000][General]
bUseThreadedAI=1 
iNumHWThreads=4[/color] // Replace this number with number of cores. Higher values is experimental!


[size=3] [b][color=#3d85c6]c)[/color][/b] [color=#3d85c6][b]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/b][/color][/size]

[color=#ffd966][b]PLEASE NOTE! [/b]Always be safe and backup files in case something goes wrong![/color]

My optimised custom [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6131/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D6131&pUp=1]ini files[/url] already contain the most of the tweaks here. If applying to your own then you must change the following in the [b]skyrimprefs.ini[/b] file found in [b][USERNAME]/My Documents/My Games/Skyrim[/b] in order for ENB to work properly:

[color=#ff0000][Display]
iMaxAnisotropy=0 [/color]// Handled by the ENB engine
[color=#ff0000]iWaterMultiSamples=0[/color] // All anti-aliasing is handled by ENB/SweetFX engine
[color=#ff0000]iMultiSample=0[/color] // All anti-aliasing is handled by ENB/SweetFX engine
[color=#ff0000]bTreesReceiveShadows=1[/color] // For small performance you 'can' switch this off
[color=#ff0000]bDrawLandShadows=1[/color] // For small performance you 'can' switch this off
[color=#ff0000]bFloatPointRenderTarget=1[/color] // If this is off you may see 'ghosting'.
[color=#ff0000]
bEnablePerPixelLighting=1 [/color]// [color=#ffd966]Experimental! (performance)[/color][b] [/b]Dynamic lighting. May cause performance issues, see chapter [b]8. ... [ADAPTIVE QUALITY][/b]
[color=#ff0000]bPerPixelLighting=1 [/color]// [color=#ffd966]Experimental! (performance)[/color][b] [/b]This value works in tandem with above and both must be on/off to have an effect
[color=#ff0000]
bHighQuality20Lighting=1[/color] // [color=#ffd966]Experimental! (performance)[/color] Increases lighting quality a little but may cause performance issues. Worth a try!

[size=3]
[b] [color=#3d85c6]d[/color][color=#3d85c6])[/color] [/b][color=#3d85c6][b]SKSE

[/b][/color][/size]While not mandatory it is highly recommended for compatibility and performance improvements. Many mods require it anyway.

[list=1]
[*]Download and install [url=http://skse.silverlock.org/]SKSE[/url] by SKSE Team (goes in the main Skyrim directory)
    
[*]Then use [b]skseloader.exe[/b] to start Skyrim with SKSE (you can create a shortcut on your desktop for easy use!)
[/list][b][color=#3d85c6][size=3]

 e) 3GB Switch[/size][/color] [/b][color=#ffd966][size=2](use at your own risk!)[/size][/color]

[url=http://scorpion.tordivel.no/help/GettingStarted/3gswitch.htm]3GB Switch[/url] (Only 'needed' if you have 4GB on a [b][u]32 bit system[/u][/b]!)




[b][size=4][color=#3d85c6] ___ [/color]4. COMPATIBILITY AND RECOMMENDED MODS [color=#3d85c6]__[/color][/size][/b]

This ENB preset should be compatible with most lighting and weather mods with a few minor tweaks to brightness/contrast levels. Always read mod pages for information on compatible mods, but as a rough rule however it is advised you:

 - Avoid combining numerous outdoor lighting mods together
 - Avoid combining numerous indoor/dungeon lighting mods together
 - Avoid using darker nights or darker dungeon mods with ENB and/or other lighting mods
 - ENB Weather and other weather/environment mods are usually different and do not mix well
 - For colour correction I highly recommend [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13049/?]Imaginator[/url] by [b]MGE[/b]

I have fully tested this preset with the following:

[color=#3d85c6][b]Vanilla Skyrim[/b][/color]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?]Climates of Tamriel[/url] and for [b]3.1[/b] users the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/39799/?]Weather Patch[/url] - [b]jjc71 and prod80[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30450/?]Realistic Lighting Overhaul[/url] - [b]sydney666[/b]


I am currently using the following (please use [url=https://loot.github.io/]LOOT[/url] to organise your load order!):

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50065/?]Natural Lighting and Atmospherics for ENB[/url] (esp and enbseries/weather files only) - [b]Confidence Man[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9930/?]Revamped Exterior Fog[/url] - [b]gargorias[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50855/?]Shadows[/url] (without Weather Tweaks) - [b]HHaleyy[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63478/?]True Storms[/url] - [b]fadingsignal[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/64941/?]Wonders of Weather[/url] - [b]isoku[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/15506/?]Lighting during Thunderstorms[/url] - [b]Minty911[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1702/?]Random Thunder[/url] - [b]wordeee[/b]
[url=http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=1499]Skyrim Particle Patch[/url] (aka Bright Object Fix) - [b]mindflux[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12866/?]Distant Detail[/url] - [b]dovahsbane[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/141/?]Skyrim Flora Overhaul[/url] - [b]vurt[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/41076/?]RealisticWaterTwo[/url] - [b]isoku[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13049/?]Imaginator[/url] - [b]MGE[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/18916/?]Lanterns of Skyrim[/url] - [b]mannygt[/b]
Lanterns of Skyrim Realistic Kilo Preset (currently hidden for bug fixes!)




[b][size=4][color=#e69138] [/color][color=#3d85c6]___ [/color]5. MAIN INSTALLATION [color=#3d85c6]_____________[/color][/size][/b]

[b]
[b][color=#ffd966][b]PLEASE NOTE! [/b]Always be safe and backup files in case something goes wrong![/color][/b]

ATTENTION! [/b]Remember the best way to avoid conflicts is a clean install!

[list=1]
[*]Put [b]enbhost.exe[/b], [b]d3d9.dll,[/b] [b]SweetFX files[/b] and [b]d3d9_boost.dll [/b](Booster Version only) from [b]3. REQUIREMENTS [/b]into your [b]Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim[/b] directory ([u]NOT[/u] the [b]data[/b] folder!)
 
[*]Put the [b]files from my download[/b] into your [b]Skyrim[/b] directory and [b]OVERWRITE[/b] "SweetFX_settings.txt" when it asks
 
[*]Now put the [b]enbhelper.dll[/b] in the [b]enbseries[/b] [b]folder[/b] you installed from step 2)
 
[*]Please see the [b]GRAPHICS DRIVER SETTINGS[/b] section in[b] [/b]chapter[b] 8. CUSTOMISATION AND TWEAKING[/b]
[/list] 
[b] 
NOTICE![/b] I highly recommend you check out my optimised [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6131/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D6131&pUp=1]ini files[/url] which are fine tuned for use with this ENB!
 

 [size=2][color=#3d85c6][b]OPTIONAL[/b] [/color][color=#ffd966](may cause performance issues!)[/color][/size]

[list=1]
[*]For additional filters and custom shaders please see chapter [b]9. OPTIONAL EFFECTS[/b]
[/list][b]

 [color=#ffd966][u]TROUBLESHOOTING STEPS[/u][/color] [/b]

[list=1]
[*]Don't forget you can use the in-game brightness setting to quickly adjust your particular monitor/TV to an ENB setup as every combination is slightly different. If your monitor/TV itself has adjustments, please also try calibrate these to improve brightness/contrast and saturation. This of course involves zero performance cost!
 
[*]If you have any other visual or performance issues please be sure to read chapter [b]4. COMPATIBILITY AND RECOMMENDED MODS[/b], chapter [b]8. CUSTOMISATION AND TWEAKING[/b] and chapter [b]9. OPTIONAL EFFECTS[/b]
[b]  [/b]
[*]If you are using the [b]ReShade Version[/b] try the [b]Booster Version[/b] and vice versa!
  
[*]For performance or compatibility issues try the NoToD (No Time of Day) versions, which are even faster still by removing Sky Lighting. Still looks good too!
   
[*]If you are still having problems then take a look through my modding guide [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6131/?]The Skyrim Tweak Guide -- Quality-Stable-Performance --[/url] which should help in getting a smooth Skyrim expereince!
  
[*]Ask me!
[/list]



[b][size=4][color=#e69138] [/color][color=#3d85c6]___ [/color]6. NVIDIA INSTALLATION NOTES [color=#3d85c6]_____[/color][/size][/b]

The [b]Booster Version[/b] uses a 'booster' which causes the graphics card to be changed in [b]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/b] to the following:

[color=#ff0000]sD3DDevice="NVIDIA GeForce 8800 GS"
[/color]

You can alternatively just use the custom [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6131/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D6131&pUp=1]ini files[/url].




[b][size=4][color=#e69138] [/color][color=#3d85c6]___ [/color]7. ATI INSTALLATION NOTES [color=#3d85c6]______[/color][/size][/b][b][color=#3d85c6][size=4]_[/size][/color]
[/b]
Please read this [url=http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=4634&sid=28f3527669aca114e490628810adc6ff]d[/url][url=http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=23&t=4634&sid=28f3527669aca114e490628810adc6ff]isclaimer from Boris[/url][b].[/b]

The 'booster' in the [b]Booster Version[/b] [u]will not[/u] work because the card is not Nvidia based... obviously! :D

In this case, after installing, go to [b]enblocal.ini[/b] in your [b]Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim[/b] directory where you can change the line (3):

[color=#ff0000]ProxyLibrary=d3d9_boost.dll[/color]

to

[color=#ff0000]ProxyLibrary=none[/color]

or

Use the [b]ReShade Version[/b] which should be compatible with pretty much any desktop setup!




[b][size=4][color=#3d85c6] ___ [/color]8. CUSTOMISATION AND TWEAKING[color=#3d85c6] __[/color][/size][/b]

This section is to guide you through ENB/SweetFX presets with where and how to customise colours, lighting, performance and other visual effects.

These tweaks are also designed to be help you apply my optimisations to most other modern ENB configurations for increased performance and customisation. If a value I have here is missing just add it!


[size=4][b] [/b][color=#3d85c6][b]ENB[/b][/color][/size]

There are three main files to worry about when dealing with ENB customisation. Each have their own options and purpose and I will go through the main features and values that are of greatest interest for basic performance, effect and visual balance. Some of these settings are available to change in-game for ease (Shift + F12) but can give false positives or unpredictable results until the game is restarted.

[b]PLEASE NOTE![/b] After much testing it is apparent that the settings and values in the ENB files actually have an effect on visuals and performance despite whether the feature is supposedly 'off' or not. What this means is that [b]even if [/b]'SkyLighting' is 'false', for example, its quality settings actually affect performance. It was only by realising this that I was able to radically increase performance, however this can work both ways and allow some effects to be 'enabled' for less cost!

[b][size=3][color=#ffd966] enblocal.ini[/color] [/size][/b]

The file is found here: [b]Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim/enblocal.ini[/b]

This is where the main engine is configured with everything from memory management to fps clamps and anisotropic filtering. If an entry/value is missing its because it is either best left as it is or is for specific problems/setups.

[color=#ff0000][PERFORMANCE][/color]
[color=#ff0000]EnableOcclusionCulling=true [/color] // Stops the engine from rendering things that cannot be seen so increases performance.
[color=#ff0000]EnableZPrepass=true[/color]  // Its a kind of magic... This renders depth properly and makes the picture clearer and sharper as a result!

[color=#ff0000][MEMORY][/color]
[color=#ff0000]ExpandSystemMemoryX64=true[/color] // Enables memory tweaks for 64bit systems. You may need to double-check this if on a 32 bit system and crash.
[color=#ff0000]ReduceSystemMemoryUsage=true[/color] // This reduces RAM usage and is more or less essential but disabling can give a small boost. But it will crash and freeze more often.
[color=#ff0000]DisablePreloadToVRAM=false[/color] // Useful if your save game won't load because of memory bottle-necking.
[color=#ff0000]ReservedMemorySizeMb=256[/color] // This is quite nippy on 4 > 8 GB but you can lower for less or increase if you have a lot.
[color=#ff0000]VideoMemorySizeMb=4096[/color] // Overall available RAM, 4096 seems pretty stable on 8GB try lowering if you have less and/or crash a lot.
[color=#ff0000]EnableCompression=false[/color] // Can descrease RAM but increases CPU/GPU usage and causes muddy textures.
[color=#ff0000]AutodetectVideoMemorySize=false[/color] // do not use, specify amount above.

[color=#ff0000][ENGINE][/color]
[color=#ff0000]MaxAnisotropy=8[/color] // Texture filtering (turn off the in-game setting). Increasing improves quality for performance hit. I find 8 the best balance.
[color=#ff0000]EnableVSync=true[/color] // Best left on or you will likely get tearing which looks horrible!

[color=#ff0000][LIMITER][/color]
[color=#ff0000]EnableFPSLimit=true [/color]// When on this 'clamps' the FPS. Experiment with this as it can depend on other settings, see the [b]GRAPHICS DRIVER SETTINGS[/b] section further below!
[color=#ff0000]FPSLimit=60 [/color]// Another setting that can be played with to give various results. 30 - 60 can drastically improve input lag and smooth out the frame rate. This works in conjunction with the above setting and [b]GRAPHIC DRIVER SETTINGS[/b]

[color=#ff0000][ADAPTIVE QUALITY][/color]
[color=#ff0000]Enable=true[/color] // This is very effective at reducing lag so I would leave on.
[color=#ff0000]Quality=2[/color] // This has next to no visual effect in this setup so is best left as is for best performance
[color=#ff0000]DesiredFPS=120.0 [/color]// Currently set to 120 but anything from 5 (lowest) to 1000 (highest) can help smooth fps blur/judder. Worth experimenting with!

[color=#ff0000][ANTIALIASING][/color]
[color=#ff0000]EnableEdgeAA=true [/color]// Try turn of if slow but looks better on and is quite performance friendly. Works in addition to SweetFX SMAA!

[color=#ff0000][FIX][/color]
[color=#ff0000]RemoveBlur=true[/color] // This removes the blurring effect the game uses. It can look smoother with it on but personally I think it just looks too blurry.

[b][color=#ffd966][size=3]
 enbseries.ini[/size][/color][/b]

The file is found here: [b]Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim/enbseries.ini[/b]

[b] [/b][color=#f9cb9c]Lighting[/color]

In terms of lighting there are an amazing amount of options here. I aim for these to be at a good all round setting and lighting should be the last thing to touch and only if it is quite a specific area/effect that needs fixing. Why? Because the effects are compounded and one change here makes other multipliers affect things differently - in other words it can quickly turn into a major project and likely cause other weathers and environments to look weird.

[b] [/b][color=#f9cb9c]Quality[/color]

Before just increasing quality settings please note that by using a combination of balanced lighting, COLORCORRECTION (below) [b]enbeffect.fx[/b] and [b]SweetFX_settings.txt[/b] you can achieve very similar effects for ZERO performance cost! Apart from SweetFX customisations, colours are best managed by using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13049/?]Imaginator[/url].

[b]SPECIAL THANKS! [/b]Goes to [i]killerkun[/i] for helping with some of the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50835/?]subsurface scattering levels[/url].

[color=#ff0000][BLOOM]
Quality=2 [color=#ffffff]// This has been removed from the newer ENB defualt files but can be added to specify quality/performance.
[/color][/color]
[color=#ff0000][COLORCORRECTION]
Brightness=1.0 [/color]// Brightness control
[color=#ff0000]GammaCurve=1.0 [/color]// 'Contrast' like control


[b][color=#ffd966][size=3] enbeffect.fx[/size][/color][/b]

The file is found here:[b] Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim/enbseries/enbeffect.fx[/b]

[b]ATTENTION! [/b]Only ever edit [b]POSTPROCESS 3[/b] values in the 'internal parameters' section!

[color=#ff0000]float EAdaptationMinV3 [/color]// This is difficult to wrap your head round and takes experimentation to master. I think of it as 'shadows' (from a Photoshop background) and increasing it makes the image darker.
[color=#ff0000]float EAdaptationMaxV3 [/color]// Same as the above but I try to think of it as 'highlights'. It does not work quite like that but experiment and you will see... eventually! :P
[color=#ff0000]float EToneMappingCurveV3 [/color]// This is easier to get to grips with and is a little like contrast/brightness. Increasing it makes the difference between light and dark more gradual and darker. Decreasing makes everything sharper and lighter.
[color=#ff0000]float EToneMappingOversaturationV3 [/color]// A somewhat subtle effect that can help increase or decrease colour. In my experience the difference is minimal and SweetFX is much more effective.



[size=4][color=#3d85c6] [b]SWEETFX[/b][/color][/size]

The file is found here: [b]Steam/SteamApps/common/Skyrim/SweetFX/SweetFX_settings.txt [/b](ReShade Version) and in the root folder on the Booster Version.

This allows for different techniques and greater control over balances. You can try the different effects to see what they look like, but you have to do it outside the game and then restart. Each setting then has its own finer configuration values further down and CeeJay has kindly put lots of notes in the files to help!

The most useful settings from my experience are:

[color=#ff0000]SMAA[/color] - Enabled (Lightning quick and good quality Anti Aliasing)
[color=#ff0000]Lumasharpen[/color] - Enabled (Sharpens edges and lights)
[color=#ff0000]Levels[/color] - Disabled (a little like Photoshop levels... but without the graph!)
[color=#ff0000]ToneMap[/color] - Disabled (this is my favourite for adjusting brightness/contrast/saturation, its almost like using a TV... almost...)
[color=#ff0000]Vibrance[/color] - Disabled (more specifically for saturation issues)
[color=#ff0000]Curves[/color] - Disabled (Best for adjusting contrast)



[color=#3d85c6][size=4][b] [/b][b]GRAPHICS DRIVER SETTINGS[/b][/size][/color]

Unless you have particular reasons not to (you have known issues with some games/drivers) then it is a good idea to update your graphics card. If you have any custom profiles then I suggest you back them up before doing so!

nVidia Cards: [url=https://www.nvidia.co.uk/Download/index.aspx?lang=en-uk]nVidia Driver Downloads[/url]
ATI Cards: [url=http://support.amd.com/en-us/download]AMD Driver Downloads[/url]

[b]
 [color=#3d85c6]Profiler Settings[/color][/b]

Playing around with these settings I have found setting all card values to 'DEFAULT' gives the best quality and compatibility. Below are the few values with which tweaking has given me positive results on occasion with various games. Feel free to experiment as I am sure you do, but know I have spent a couple of years of trial and error to get this far!

A good and powerful nVidia profiler is: [url=http://www.guru3d.com/files-details/nvidia-inspector-download.html]Nvidia Inspector
[/url]
[color=#ff0000]Maximum Pre-rendered frames = DEFAULT [/color]// It is sometimes useful for finding a point between smoothness and any possible lag. It works well in conjunction with a frame limiter (ENB), but can cause blur.

[color=#ff0000]Tripple Buffering = Default (OFF) [/color]// Eperimental! May improve things but can cause blur.

[color=#ff0000]Vertical Sync Smooth AFR = Default (OFF) [/color]// Can smooth things out but may also cause blurring like effect so may be down to preference.

[color=#ff0000]Texture Filtering Quality = Default[/color] // You can [u]try[/u] [b]High Performance[/b] as can be faster, but it can also cause muddy texture blur. Experiment!




[b][size=4][color=#e69138] [/color][color=#3d85c6]___ [/color]9. OPTIONAL EFFECTS[color=#e69138] [/color][color=#3d85c6]____________[/color][/size][/b]

[b]PLEASE NOTE! [/b]B[size=2]e warned that some effects can [/size][u][b]drastically[/b][/u][size=2] affect performance![/size]

[size=2]Effects in ENB depend on two things, your settings in [/size][b]enbseries.ini[/b][size=2] and the [/size][b].fx[/b][size=2] files you put in the [b]enbseries[/b] folder found in the Skyrim directory. The default files can be found in the [/size][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71029/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D71029&pUp=1]-Optional Effects-[/url][size=2] file in the downloads section, but you can also just pick and choose, and combine different effects from any other ENB and experiment till you find something you like![/size]

[size=2]Not all effects need all files but generally the effects correspond to the following list:[/size]


[b]enbeffect.fx - [/b][size=2]the core enb rendering effect code (required and already included with this preset!)[/size]
[b]enbbloom.fx[/b][size=2] - this is the bloom code file[/size]
[b]enbeffectprepass - [/b][size=2]the DOF code[/size]
[size=2][b]enblens.fx[/b] - lens effect code[/size]
[size=2][b]enbsunsprite.fx[/b] - more lens like effects specific to the sun - DOES NOT affect Godrays.[/size]


[size=4][color=#ffd966] [/color][color=#3d85c6][b]CUSTOM SHADERS[/b][/color][/size]

[size=2]Below are links to optional and custom effects/ENB presets which you can combine with the performance enhancements of this 'base' preset. They vary in effect and performance impact so experiment. Please ensure to show appreciation for files as a lot of effort and work goes into them![/size]

[b][color=#3d85c6]  [/color][color=#f9cb9c][size=2]DOF Effects[/size][/color][color=#f9cb9c]

[/color][/b]In order to use most ENB DOF effects you must set [b][color=#ff0000]bDoDepthOfField=0[/color][/b] in [b]SkyrimPrefs.ini[/b]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24024/?]Bokeh DoF and Tilt Shift[/url][size=2] by [/size][b]gp65cj04
[/b][url=http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=7&t=3224]DOF Extra and ALF Effect[/url][size=2] by [/size][b]kingeric1992
[/b][url=https://gist.github.com/FransBouma/99f041880582d35a2a25]Custom DOF Extra ALF Effect[/url][size=2] by [/size][b]OtisInf[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/151807/?tb=mods&pUp=1]Various [/url][size=2]by [/size][b]Matso[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62667/?]Kinematic ENB Southern Light[/url] (various effects)[b] [/b]by [b]Kyokushinoyama [/b]

[b][color=#f9cb9c][size=2]  Lens Texture Effects[/size][/color][/b]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/45054/?]Lens Textures for ENB[/url][size=2] by [/size][b]amoebae[/b]

[b][color=#f9cb9c][size=2]  Sunsprite Effects[/size][/color][/b]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61405/?]Human Temporal Glare Sunsprites and Shader[/url] by [b]Veeblix[/b]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32031/?]HD Volumetric sun[/url] by [b]SkyrimENB
[/b]



[b][size=4][color=#e69138] [/color][color=#3d85c6]___ [/color]10. LINKS TO OTHER MODS AND PRESETS [color=#3d85c6]__[/color][/size][/b]

Check out my modding guide [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/6131/?]The Skyrim Tweak Guide -- Quality-Stable-Performance --[/url] for more ways to improve your gaming experience and optimised ini files!

Also here are links to my other ENB and SweetFX presets as they roll out:

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout3/mods/21891?]Fallout 3[/url]
Fallout New Vegas
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/masseffect2/mods/61/?]Mass Effect 2[/url]
Dishonoured
Black Mesa
Half Life 2
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/thesecretofmonkeyisland/mods/1/?]Monkey Island Special Edition[/url]

and more coming!




[b][size=4][color=#3d85c6] ___ [/color]11. CREDITS [color=#3d85c6]___________________[/color][/size][/b]
